page.title: 06BERRINGTON HALL,EYE
page.content: {Berrington Hall}was built in the {Georgian times}. It took five years to build; it was started in 1778 and was finished in 1783.Its architect was {Henry Holland}.The{National Trust}own the Hall.The Hall was built for a rich man called Thomas Harley,he earned his money by supplying money and clothes for American troops.It was built as a country house.If you look at the house from the outside you should notice it is{symmetrical}.There are forty rooms in the Hall not including the outside buildings.There are 77 windows at the Hall, some are false but look like real windows. This is only to make it look{symmetrical}.There are about 100 lights.The Hall is built of ashlar but looks like sandstone.There are 4 storeys. In the nursery there is a lovely dolls house that has glass on the front and lots of things inside.
